stories.text: I started working on an MVP to help tech companies deliver training solutions more efficiently. I wanted to ask first, does your company care at all about employee development? Where does the money go typically? Do you as employees get a say in the courses/trainings your company spends money on?
stories.title: Ask HN: Does your company care about professional training and development?

stories.text:
Personally, I'm getting sick and tired of mods on Reddit abusing their powers. I've even come across mods disagreeing withother on bans. Its a pure joke.

Are there alternatives to Reddit that will reduce mod powert? or at very least challenge their decisions? They seems to ban users who do accept their views and it's super boring.
stories.title: Is Reddit moderation flawed? What are some alternative that reduce mod power?
